TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticationModuleElement extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Represents the type information for an authentication module. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class corresponds to the `type` attribute of the [\<add\> Element for authenticationModules (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/add-element-for-authenticationmodules-network-settings.md) configuration element.
This class is used to specify modules registered to authenticate requests made with the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebClient> classes.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor sets the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.AuthenticationModuleElement.Type%2A> property to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string typeName) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that identifies the type and the assembly that contains it.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified type information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `typeName` parameter contains the fully qualified type name followed by a comma (,) and the assembly information. The elements of the assembly information are separated with commas, for example, `Corp.Net.Authenticator, Corp, Version=1.0.5000.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken="00000000000000000"`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type and assembly information for the current instance.
Docs.value: A string that identifies a type that implements an authentication module or if no value has been specified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property contains the fully qualified type name followed by a comma (,) and the assembly information. The elements of the assembly information are separated with commas, for example, `Corp.Net.Authenticator, Corp, Version=1.0.5000.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken="00000000000000000"`.
